NOTES ON AIRPORT
Friday, Sept. 17, 1926.
At the request of the Chamber of Commerce and suggested
by the Supervisors attending the luncheon to Assistant Secretary
of the Navy Warner,
I met Mr. Warner and the officers of the
Twelfth Naval Division at Harrison and Spear Streets
at 2:30 o'clock.
We left about 3:00 o'clock and visited the South San Francisco site
and Millbrae site.
Did not visit the San Mateo
site, as it was not
suitable for hydroplanes.
Returned to San Francisco
at 4:45 o'clock.
The Assistant Secretary expressed the opinion that the
site at

a much better

times he could not state whether it was ideal or not.
He also asked
concerning drainage
on both sites and whether during
the winter
season the land would be waterlogged.

that if it were a

NOTES
ON AIRPORT
Tuesday, Sept. 14, 1926.
Called on Mr. Shaw, South San Francisco Land and Improve-
ment Company, Merchants Exchange Building.
Suggested that the limit to be paid by the City for the
100
acres involved in site lo. 2 would
$260,000.00, provided that
the land be brought to an elevation of plus 10 feet by the present
owner; that in addition, the land Company would have include
right of way for a spur track from the Belt Railroad into the
proposed aeroplane site.
Mr.
Shaw stated that if we submitted the offer it would
be forwarded to his company, but that he would not recommend its
acceptance.
Mr. Shaw'g price on the above site as per the conditions
mentioned above 1s $340,000.00 for an area of approximately 100
Called on Ir. Medina, Mr. Howard Sr. and Ir. Howard Jr.,
Bank of California, in re site No. 1.
They agreed to sell to the City all land that we wish
east of the present transmission line and including the land
both
sides 01 : the Bay Shore Boulevard, with the exception 01 twO
easements for road purposes at the northerly and southerly
boundaries, these easements to be used for road purposes only.
Would deliver the same subject to confirmation on the part of Mrs.
Taylor for $2,000.00 per acre.
I stated to them that the price should be between $750.00
and $1,000.00 per acre, and requested them to submit this proposi-
tion to their principals.

Manner and the officers of the

We also visited the Millbrae site and the Assistant
